headline: McCormick (NYSE:MKC) Reports Q1 Sales Rise to US$1,605 Million but 2% Profit Dip
summary: McCormick (NYSE:MKC) recently announced its Q1 2025 earnings, reporting a slight increase in sales to $1,606 million, but a fall in net income and earnings per share, reflecting subtle pressures on the company's profitability. Meanwhile, the market showed resilience with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq gaining after a recent downturn, which might paint a favorable backdrop for the company's 2.96% price increase over the last quarter. Potential acquisition plans hinted by the company could also play a...

headline: McCormick Q1 miss: The company is stable, but not a growth stock
summary: Spice and seasoning producer McCormick (MKC) missed first quarter estimates, with price cuts and promotions failing to boost sales, though the company reaffirmed its fiscal outlook. Yahoo Finance's Trader Talk podcast host Kenny Polcari joins Catalysts anchor Madison Mills to discuss the company’s performance and the competitive nature of its market. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.

headline: Why Is Food Company McCormick Stock Trading Lower Today?
summary: Shares of McCormick & Co Inc (NYSE:MKC) are trading lower in premarket on Tuesday after the company reported worse-than-expected first-quarter FY25 earnings. The company reported first-quarter sales growth of 0.2% year-on-year to $1.605 billion, missing the analyst consensus estimate of $1.612 billion. Flavor Solutions segment sales increased 1% from the first quarter of 2024 to $686 million, including a 2% unfavorable impact from currency. Consumer segment sales of $919 million were consistent

headline: McCormick Stock Slides as Earnings Miss Estimates
summary: McCormick  stock fell Tuesday after the spices and seasonings maker reported first-quarter earnings that failed to meet Wall Street’s expectations.  Shares fell 3.5% to $77.50 in premarket trading after  McCormick  posted adjusted earnings of 60 cents a share for the quarter ended Feb. 28, missing analysts’ calls for 64 cents, according to FactSet.  Sales were flat from the previous year, as 2% volume growth was offset by a 2% negative currency impact.

headline: McCormick (NYSE:MKC) Reports Sales Below Analyst Estimates In Q1 Earnings, Stock Drops
summary: Food flavoring company McCormick (NYSE:MKC) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales flat year on year at $1.61 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.60 per share was 6.8% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: McCormick: Fiscal Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: HUNT VALLEY, Md. AP) — McCormick & Co. (MKC) on Tuesday reported fiscal first-quarter net income of $162.3 million. On a per-share basis, the Hunt Valley, Maryland-based company said it had net income of 60 cents.
